content:
Diagnosis:	Hepatocellular carcinoma, BCLC stage B

Initial diagnosis March 2023 with multifocal disease in segments 4a, 5 and 8. AFP at diagnosis 450. Child-Pugh A5 liver function with background hepatitis B cirrhosis.

Treatment with TACE to all lesions April 2023 and July 2023 with good response.

I reviewed [redacted name] today in follow-up clinic. He remains well with stable performance status and good appetite. No symptoms suggestive of disease progression. Latest AFP has fallen to 120. Recent triple-phase CT liver (15/09/2023) shows stable post-TACE appearances with no new lesions identified. Child-Pugh score remains A5 with well-preserved synthetic function.

The plan is to continue surveillance with 3-monthly AFP and imaging. Next triple-phase CT liver arranged for December 2023. Will review in clinic with results. Patient understands to contact us sooner if new symptoms develop.

cancer_timeline.value: Triple-phase CT liver shows stable post-TACE appearances with no new lesions

patient_facts.value: Child-Pugh A5 with well-preserved synthetic function

status_updates.value: Multifocal HCC treated with two rounds of TACE showing stable disease on imaging and falling AFP
Stable post-TACE appearances with no new lesions, AFP decreased to 120
Stable performance status with good appetite
Triple-phase CT liver arranged for December 2023
Review in clinic with CT results
